pageContext.claim: “We have 100 million people... I call them the forgotten man, the forgotten woman.  But a lot of those people, a good percentage of them, would like to have jobs, and they don’t.”
pageContext.analysis: This is an absurd Four-Pinocchio claim, based on a real number. The 100 million "forgotten" that Trump refers to are based on Bureau of Labor Statistics data from 2015. It turns out that 93 percent do not want a job at all. The picture that emerges from a study of the data shows that the 95 million consists mostly of people who are retired, students, stay-at-home parents or disabled.
